intro: Coprosma egmontiana, commonly known as Egmont coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and are followed by small, fleshy berries. Coprosma egmontiana is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
